core.utils.get_graph_data(user, labels, **kwargs)¶

Retrieves the data used for progress graphs.

Parameters

  • user (Respondent) – The Respondent whose progress is to be displayed.

  • labels (List[str]) – List of string datetimes that are the labels on the x-axis of the graph that to be displayed.

Keyword Arguments
  • group (Group) If passed, this method shall return the

    progress values for the labels for the group that is passed.

Returns

List of values of length len(labels) corresponding to the values to be plotted.

Return type

List[float]

core.utils.get_graph_labels(user, **kwargs)¶

Retrieves the x-axis labels (dates) used for progress graphs.

Parameters

user (Surveyor / Respondent) – A Surveyor/Respondent representing the user currently logged in.

Returns

A sorted list containing the dates to be used as x-axis labels.

Return type

List[str]

core.utils.get_groups(user)¶

Retrieves the Groups which the user is a manager/member of.

Parameters

user (Surveyor / Respondent) – A Surveyor/Respondent representing the user currently logged in.

Raises

ValueError – Raised if the user type specified is not recognised.

Returns

A QuerySet of the Groups which user manages or is a member of.

Return type

django.db.models.QuerySet

core.utils.get_leaderboard(user, **kwargs)¶

Retrieves a sorted list containing the names and scores of the members of the leaderboard.

Parameters

user (Surveyor / Respondent) – A Surveyor/Respondent representing the user currently logged in.

Keyword Arguments

  • group (uuid.UUID) The UUID of the Group for which user is accessing the leaderboard.

Returns

Sorted descending list containing the full names and scores of of the members of the leaderboard.

Return type

List[dict]

core.utils.get_tasks(user)¶
core.utils.has_responded_to_task(respondent, task)¶

Returns a boolean value representing if a certain Respondent has responded to a given Task.

Parameters

  • respondent (Respondent) – The Respondent for which to check Responses from.

  • task (Task) – The Task for which to check Responses to.

Returns

Returns True` if the number of ``Responses to the given Task is equal to the number of Questions, False otherwise

Return type

bool
